sen.j: 佐伯有頼（さえき の ありより、 676年頃 - 759年？）は、飛鳥時代の越中国の国司、佐伯有若の息子。
sen.e: SAEKI no Ariyori (approx 676 - 759) was son of SAEKI no Ariwaka, an officer of Ecchu Province in the Asuka period.

sen.e: It is believed that, having received a spiritual message, he climbed Mt. Tate and founded a great sacred ground for the syncretism of Shinto and Buddhism.

sen.j: 有頼が父の白鷹を父に無断で持ち出し狩をしていると、白鷹は急に現れた熊に驚き逃げてしまう。
sen.e: When Ariyori went hunting, taking his father's white hawk without permission, a bear suddenly appeared and scared the hawk away.

sen.j: 有頼が矢で熊を射ると、熊は血を流しながら逃げていった。
sen.e: When he shot an arrow at the bear, the bear ran away bleeding.
When he shot an arrow at the bear, the bear ran away bleeding.

sen.j: 洞穴の中へと続く血の後を見つけ、弓を構えて中を伺うと、そこに居たのは矢を射立てられた阿弥陀如来であった。
sen.e: He followed blood marks on the ground towards a cave. He looked inside, with his bow and arrow at the ready, and saw Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata) who had an arrow stuck in his body.
He followed blood marks on the ground towards a cave, and looked inside with his bow and arrow at the ready, and found Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata) who had an arrow stuck in his body.

sen.e: He followed blood marks on the ground towards a cave, and looked inside with his bow and arrow at the ready, and found Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata) who had an arrow stuck in his body.

sen.j: 嘆き悲しむ有頼に向け阿弥陀如来は、白鷹もまた立山の神の化身で有頼を導くための使いであり、僧になりこの山を開くよう告げた。
sen.e: He told Ariyori, who was grieving about what he had done, that the hawk was an incarnation of the God of Mt. Tate who was sent to guide him and that he should become a priest and found a temple on Mt.Tate.

Amida Nyorai told Ariyori, who was grieving about what he had done, that the hawk was an incarnation of the God of Mt. Tate who was sent to guide him to Amida Nyorai and that he should become a priest and found a temple on Mt.Tate.
sen.cmt: 意味を明確にするため以下の変更をしました。 文頭のHe→Amida Nyorai to Amida Nyorai をguide himの後に追加。
sen.e: Amida Nyorai told Ariyori, who was grieving about what he had done, that the hawk was an incarnation of the God of Mt. Tate who was sent to guide him to Amida Nyorai and that he should become a priest and found a temple on Mt.Tate.

sen.j: 立山の為に生涯を尽くすことを誓った有頼は直ちに下山し父頼若にこの事を告げると、出家し名を慈興に改め、立山開山の為に尽力した。
sen.e: Ariyori, having pledged to dedicate his life to Mt. Tate, went down the mountain to tell his father, Yoriwaka, of his vocation. He became a priest and changed his name to Jiko and made a great effort to found the temple on Mt. Tate.
sen.cmt: 頼若は有若 (Ariwaka)の誤りと見受けられます。
sen.e: Ariyori, having pledged to dedicate his life to Mt. Tate, went down the mountain to tell his father, Ariwaka, of his vocation, and he became a priest, changed his name to Jiko and made a great effort to found the temple on Mt. Tate.
sen.cmt: 一文にまとめました。 2番目のHe→, and and changed→, changed Yoriwaka→Ariwaka

sen.j: 没後、雄山神社立山若宮に神として祀られる。
sen.e: After he died, he was enshrined as a God in the Tate-yama Wakamiya Shrine of the Oyama-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 古文書には立山町宮路に墓が記されたものもある。
sen.e: His grave is mentioned in some ancient documents in the Miyaji district of Tateyama Town.

sen.j: 立山・剱方面の山小屋経営者や山岳ガイドには、有頼の末裔の家系伝承を持つ佐伯姓の人物が多い。
sen.e: Many cottage owners and mountain guides around Mt. Tate and Mt. Tsurugi have the surname of SAEKI who are descendants of Ariyori.
Many cottage owners and mountain guides around Mt. Tate and Mt. Tsurugi have the surname of SAEKI and are said to be descendants of Ariyori.

sen.e: Many cottage owners and mountain guides around Mt. Tate and Mt. Tsurugi have the surname of SAEKI and are said to be descendants of Ariyori.

sen.j: 立山黒部アルペンルート売店のイメージキャラクターとして、佐伯有頼をモデルに2006年より登場した。
sen.e: SAEKI no Ariyori was used as the mascot for shops along the Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route and it was launched in 2006.
Ariyori-kun is a mascot character modeled on SAEKI no Ariyori, which has been used by shops along the Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route since the mascot character was created in 2006.
sen.cmt: SAEKI no Ariyori was usedは不適当な訳文と思われます。また、現在も使用されているキャラクターなので現在完了を用いた文とし全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Ariyori-kun is a mascot character modeled on SAEKI no Ariyori, which has been used by shops along the Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route since the mascot character was created in 2006.
